title: 113_s2008
content: The "SCORE for Small Business Act of 2014" authorizes appropriations for the SCORE program under the Small Business Act, with specific funding amounts allocated for fiscal years 2015-2017. The Small Business Act is amended to define the SCORE program as providing counseling, mentoring, and coaching to small business owners at no cost. The SCORE program offers personal counseling, mentoring, and coaching for small business owners, as well as low-cost education workshops. The program aims to use tools and resources from other organizations to support its services. The Administrator, in consultation with the SCORE Association, ensures that the program develops plans to effectively serve individuals in rural areas and economically disadvantaged communities. The SCORE Association provides counseling, mentoring, and coaching for small business owners in disadvantaged communities. They submit an annual report detailing the number of individuals counseled, hours of counseling provided, and the formation and expansion of small businesses with SCORE's assistance. The SCORE program provides counseling and mentoring for small business owners in disadvantaged communities. Privacy requirements prohibit the disclosure of personal information without consent, except in specific legal situations. The Administrator may disclose information for financial audits of the SCORE program, limited to necessary data. This does not restrict access to program data or prevent the use of client information for surveys. Regulations will be issued to establish standards for this purpose. The regulations will establish standards for financial audit disclosures and client surveys, ensuring maximum privacy protection. An inspector general will oversee compliance until the regulations take effect. The regulations issued under this subparagraph require approval from the Inspector General for client surveys and the use of client information, to be included in the semi-annual report. SEC. 4. REPEAL OF AUTHORITY FOR THE PROGRAM FOR INVESTMENT IN MICROENTREPRENEURS. Repeal of Subtitle C of title I of the Riegle Community Development and Regulatory Improvement Act of 1994. Rule of Construction: Grants or assistance provided under the repealed subtitle C will still be subject to its provisions before the enactment of this Act. SEC. 5. TECHNICAL AND CONFORMING AMENDMENTS. The Small Business Act is amended to replace "Service Corps of Retired Executives" with "SCORE program" in various sections. The Children's Health Insurance Program Reauthorization Act of 2009 and the Energy Policy and Conservation Act are amended to replace "Service Corps of Retired Executives" with "SCORE program" in various sections.
